info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 27 at 2:00PM MDT until March 27 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Rapid City SD
info.description:
...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 6 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 314, 315, 316, AND 317...
.Critical fire weather conditions will continue this afternoon over northeastern WY. Highs in the 70s, MinRH around 15 percent, and southwesterly wind gusts around 30 mph are expected. Additionally, very dry/well-mixed boundary layer with some mid- level moisture may result in spotty virga showers this afternoon. Confidence is low in the development of virga, however, should any develop, gusty, erratic winds are expected.
* AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zones 314 Northern Campbell, 315 Southern Campbell, 316 Crook County Plains and 317 Weston County Plains.
* WINDS...Southwest 10 to 20 mph with gusts up to 35 mph.
* RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 13 percent.
* IMPACTS...The combination of gusty winds and low relative humidity would produce critical fire weather conditions.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

parameter.value: RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 314, 315, 316, AND 317

area.areaDesc: Northern Campbell; Southern Campbell; Crook County Plains; Weston County Plains
